sn35.7:0.3: The Interior as Impermanent in the Three Times
sn35.7:1.1: “Monks, the seer of the past and future is impermanent,
sn35.7:1.3: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the seer of the past,
sn35.7:1.4: they don’t look forward to enjoying the seer in the future,
sn35.7:1.5: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the seer in the present.
sn35.7:1.14: the thinker of the past and future is impermanent,
sn35.7:1.16: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the thinker of the past,
sn35.7:1.17: they don’t look forward to enjoying the thinker in the future,
sn35.7:1.18: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the thinker in the present.”
